content.description: This follows the crack on the slab straight up and tops out to the left.
content.location: With the road to your left, this is the crack that runs up the center of the slab.

content.description: Start with your hands on the crimps in the "blown out hole", and go up and slightly left. Follow the vein up. Move up until you get to some jugs, and top out.
content.location: With the road to your left and the parking area behind you, this is on the slab up the second from the right vein.

content.description: Start with your hands matched on the 2 crimps in the "blown out hole", and move right. Use a foot out right and a solid few hands toward the top. This is the rightmost line.
content.location: If the main road is to your left, you will be looking at the main slab. Roughly 20 feet in from the road is this climb.

content.description: Starting on the far left of the slab roughly where the road is, use any holds accept the top to traverse from the road to the crimps in the "blown out hole".
content.location: This uses the whole slab in this area.

content.description: This is a slab close to the top of the mountain. You can park right at this boulder if you drive up. Other climbs can be found in this area, but the slab is the most worthy climbing.
